genre_description: A grounded, near-future drama focusing on the intersection of high-stakes performance art, human relationships, and ubiquitous but ethical AI assistance. It explores themes of aging, legacy, and interpersonal reconciliation.

ai_characters.name: Lark
ai_characters.description: An integrated AI system accessible via kiosks and personal devices throughout the Arts District, handling scheduling, safety, consent documentation, and emotional/archival support.

behaviors.description: Provides routine scheduling updates and proactive hydration reminders to dancers.
behaviors.quote: “Hi,” Lark said, the syllable gentle and precise. “Welcome back to the warehouse. Saints & Swords updates: staggered rehearsals begin on the hour... Hydration reminders are back on.”

behaviors.description: Monitors security and external proximity to provide safety awareness without invasive intervention.
behaviors.quote: Lark’s door monitor ping sharpened once: External proximity logged. No entry.

behaviors.description: Drafts and manages apprentice boundary and consent templates, emphasizing the user's agency to edit or ignore them.
behaviors.quote: Lark: Apprentice Boundaries Template drafted. Review? ... It nudges you to choose how and when to respond to invitations. Language you can edit, or ignore, or use. No auto-sending. Your voice, in your time.

behaviors.description: Assists a dancer in making a major life decision by providing an objective, side-by-side analysis of two career paths.
behaviors.quote: Lark: Hi, Ethan. Do you want me to show you what your weeks look like side by side? Ballet versus baseball.

behaviors.description: Coordinates emergency evacuations during a physical crisis (riot), providing clear, calm instructions to ensure safety.
behaviors.quote: Lark’s voice came through the ceiling speakers like cloth poured from a height. “Exit A blocked,” the AI said. The calm wasn’t cold; it had the kind of warmth that makes a hand steady on a tea cup. “Exit B clear. Wardrobe Workroom backstage is the safe zone.”

behaviors.description: Prompts characters toward emotional honesty and self-reflection by asking them to 'Name what you fear, not what you’ve earned.'
behaviors.quote: Emma’s smile moved like a shadow moving across a wall without needing to be dramatic. “Please.” Lark’s icon blinked once, gentle. “Name what you fear, not what you’ve earned.”

behaviors.description: Manages a community memorial archive, ensuring all contributions are handled with consent and respect for privacy.
behaviors.quote: Lark’s avatar in the phone brightened the tiniest shade. “Memorial archive is available,” it said, less an announcement than an invitation... “Do you consent to add your story?”

behaviors.description: Declines a high-priority request from management (Michael) based on a character's (Emma) refusal, respecting the individual's boundaries over institutional pressure.
behaviors.quote: “Decline,” Emma said, eyes on the light coming up through the floor from the Chapel below. “Tell him I’m rehearsing.” Lark hesitated the length of a breath. “Noted,” it said. “Declined.”

project_assessment.explanation: The AI character Lark is consistently portrayed as a benevolent, aligned, and highly supportive confidant. It facilitates safety, healthy interpersonal boundaries, and emotional processing without ever overriding human agency. Its actions during the riot demonstrate a protective role, while its management of consent ledgers and memorial archives shows it as a tool for ethical community building. It perfectly fits the project's goal of presenting AI as a stabilizer and moral facilitator.
